channel.title: @ everyone that played rscu
channel.description: whos mad they trained to flats for 2 weeks straight only for the server to die right after and you to join tx's botnet?

item.title: @ everyone that played rscu
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

cleako:

The dyslexic skiddy still comes back with new accounts every week but he did not even share the working pets code that he copied from what NotPro came up with and I posted a video of in the show off area. The whole advertisement was about having pets that follow you and fight things. I spent three frustrating days for several hours on end and never got pet NPCs to follow the player. Way to rub it in my face after the time he used my trust in 2009 to install a botnet IRC control server on my dedicated server for the infected users of RSBot (http://www.powerbot.org/) while lying about it the entire time. He had the admins held hostage by DDoSing them, then telling them he could fix their servers if they let him in too. Infected all of them I’m sure.[/quote][quote=“cleako, post:4, topic:421270”]You get what you deserve for trusting that turkish idiot.[/quote][quote=“latifundio, post:10, topic:421270”][quote author=Davidi2 ] Basically he’s just an untrustworthy malicious faggot who has it out for RSCE and tries to infect anyone he can[/quote]

Read full topic

@cleako wrote:

I appreciate you posting that; however, do I still need to refactor the the DelayedEvent class to have the constructor as Entity instead of Player? What has to be changed?

Has the code you posted been designed for being put in a Pet class or in the Player class? What else must be added or imported?

Read full topic

item.title: @ everyone that played rscu
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“cleako, post:6, topic:421270”]The dyslexic skiddy still comes back with new accounts every week but he did not even share the working pets code that he copied from what NotPro came up with and I posted a video of in the show off area. The whole advertisement was about having pets that follow you and fight things. I spent three frustrating days for several hours on end and never got pet NPCs to follow the player. Way to rub it in my face after the time he used my trust in 2009 to install a botnet IRC control server on my dedicated server for the infected users of RSBot (http://www.powerbot.org/) while lying about it the entire time. He had the admins held hostage by DDoSing them, then telling them he could fix their servers if they let him in too. Infected all of them I’m sure.[/quote]Pet following is retardedly easy…

[code] public void follow(final Mob m, final long timeout) {
resetPath();
if (following != null)
following.stop();
following = new DelayedEvent(this, 250) {

		private long start = GameEngine.getTime();

		public void run() {
			if (timeout != -1 && GameEngine.getTime() - start > timeout) {
				owner.resetPath();
				if (ownerN.isPet()) {
					ownerN.follow(Pet.getOwner(ownerN));
				}
				stop();
				return;
			}
			if (!m.withinRange(owner, 16) || m.isRemoved()
					|| (owner.isBusy())) {
				stop();
				resetPath();
				if (ownerN.isPet())
					ownerN.follow(Pet.getOwner(ownerN));
			} else if (!owner.finishedPath() && owner.withinRange(m, 1)) {
				owner.resetPath();
			} else if (owner.finishedPath() && !owner.withinRange(m, 1)) {
				owner.setPath(new Path(owner.getX(), owner.getY(),
						m.getX(), m.getY()));
			}
		}
	};
	Instance.getDelayedEventHandler().add(following);
}

[/code]

The DelayedEvent needed to be refactored to have the constructor as Entity rather than Player.

Read full topic
